column4: Skype isn't working on ubuntu 8.04, I get sound, but I cannot send sound?
So, my friends won't hear me.
you should change a little bit ;)
change color of my text?
try to set the sound settings to pulse, that should help ;)
The sound is set to pulseaudio, and I can't change it
can't you change it? weird ;)

do you have a screenshot of your exact problem? my skype works perfectly. i got pavu installed by the way, that helps imo to get the sound harder, sometimes it is not hard enough, perhaps that's the problem.  Try to install pavu ;)
sorry, i mean pavucontrol; sudo apt-get install pavucontrol
Thanks snicksie, I'll try that, just a moment
Microphone, Speakers and Ringing, they are all set on "PulseAudio (local)", and I can't change any of them
Microphone, Speakers and Ringing, they are all set on "PulseAudio (local)", and I can't change any of them.
applications-> sound & video -> pulseaudio device chooser
ok, I'll  test that
There's no such thing as that in the Applications>Sound and video menu?
:S
I don't get it, I installed pavucontrol just as you said, but it isn't in the applications>Sound and Video menu?
hm, here it was, try terminal -> pavucontrol
Oh, now it worked =D
Thanks sooo much! I changed the sound controls a bit and now it's working perfectly fine!!! =D thanks again!
it's all right, nice to help people ;) they help me too ;)
